vocabulary.definition: the basic physical and organizational structures and facilities needed for the operation of a society or enterprise
vocabulary.example: The government invested in improving the country's infrastructure by building new roads and bridges.

vocabulary.definition: very great in amount, scale, or intensity
vocabulary.example: The team put in tremendous effort to complete the project ahead of schedule.

vocabulary.definition: intrusion on a person's territory, rights, etc.
vocabulary.example: The construction of the new highway led to the encroachment of the wildlife sanctuary.
The earthquake had catastrophic effects on the city, leaving thousands homeless.

vocabulary.definition: to convert into or express in the form of currency
vocabulary.example: The content creator was unable to monetize the video due to copyright issues.

vocabulary.definition: limited to a particular individual or group; not shared
vocabulary.example: The boutique offers exclusive designer clothing that is not available elsewhere.
